website_summaries.verdict: A great price for a quality baby wrap with a lifetime guarantee or your money back.
pros: A soft, comfortable design with top quality breathable cotton spandex blend of material
Features include the ability to carry a baby up to 35 pounds as well as a nursing cover
cons: Not quite as versatile as our best of the best pick
Comes in four shades of gray, and not other colors
Hard to beat for the price

customer_reviews.title: Great wrap. Baby loved it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wrap because of the good reviews and reasonable price. My newborn baby wanted to be held ALL the time. It was very difficult carrying him around the house with me all day. I watched a YouTube video of how to wrap an infant who cannot hold their head up and this wrap became my lifesaver. He fussed a little while I tucked him in, but he would always fall asleep within mins. I highly recommend this wrap if you need both hands free and want to comfortably wear your baby.
customer_reviews.author: BrittG

customer_reviews.title: Prefect for pregnant belly support!
customer_reviews.text: This fabric is perfect for this type of wearing because it is not overly stretchy like most wraps these days. The support is awesome for growing belly, aching hips, tense shoulders, and helps you hold correct posture. Here is a photo of what the wrap looks like as belly support! You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Escoriaza

customer_reviews.title: Works well on cats also
customer_reviews.text: This item was well priced and not complicated to wear. The material is not bulky, strong, soft with just enough give. Directions with pictures on how to wear it were perfect. I used this baby wrap for my 10 lbs. cat who likes to cuddle. Because I wasn't risking an exorbitant amount of money I thought I'd try it and if it didn't work it would be no big loss. My cat loves it especially being able to walk around with me and still cuddle. I really like it because I can use my hands for other things. It's a win-win.
customer_reviews.author: Charlemagne

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy material
customer_reviews.text: This was bought as a gift, so I did not use it myself, but I had a Boba wrap with each of my kids and I felt that this KeaBabies wrap had thicker and more sturdy (but very soft!) material in comparison. My babies were too heavy for the Boba after they turned 4 months, but I feel like KeaBabies wrap will be able to used much longer because there is just enough stretch, but not too much! Great price, great packaging, would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Green Mountain

customer_reviews.title: IM IN LOVE WITH THIS WRAP CARRIER
customer_reviews.text: IM IN LOVE WITH THIS WRAP CARRIER! My son falls asleep instantly every time we use it.... I can breastfeed him when he’s in the sling and it’s comfortable for me and baby. I absolutely love this because it’s secure, safe and comfy for baby and I look good using it at the grocery store , lol. My other carrier is bulky and the straps fall off my shoulders when he’s in it- but, this wrap is sooo comfortable I sometimes forget I’m wearing it;) it’s great for that skin to skin contact:) make more colors! I’d buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Cris

customer_reviews.title: Love It!!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and I LOVE the color! Comes with instruction and a nice gift box. I like how the material is thick and supportive unlike boba wrap which doesn’t hold after some time. I watched the video tutorial and tried it in front of the mirror. Was easy to learn and follow through. Now it just take me 30sec to put it on. Snuggling baby while staying hands free is the best! Everytime baby gets fussy, just put him in and he sleeps after a few minutes. Never been happier! This is a MUST HAVE for mommies!
customer_reviews.author: Mateeka

customer_reviews.title: Great handy wrap.
customer_reviews.text: Great handy wrap. Im a guy 250lbs, and this thing is so great, comfy for me and my baby. Keep one in the truck and one in the house. We own the ergo (two types, $140+ each) and really this works for us better than the ergo when she was little (10 - 16 lbs) Easy to put on and baby is so comfy and secure. I used this while playing with my older daughter on the playground and baby was secure and comfy. Baby often falls asleep when I use this. Packs down to nothing and you cannot beat the price. Aloha
customer_reviews.author: Kuaaina

customer_reviews.title: I'm Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I like it. A little shorter than I expected. Our first one we lost and it was really long. I am a plus sized mommy and wrapping little man around me I can only tie it in the back. I love it though. It is durable and soft. Gets the job done and it very comfortable for myself as well. Step by step instructions on how to wrap your baby different ways. Constant emails to make sure you got the product and if needing assistance. Very great. Baby loves it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jealena Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Blah
customer_reviews.text: Updated. I’m not gigantic but I’m not skinny. It doesn’t properly fit if i follow the instructions. Shout out to the customer service team for being great and issuing me a refund! They didn’t have to do that at all and they took the time to contact me and make me happy!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley stash

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as Boba🤷
customer_reviews.text: I have now tried the Boba, the K'Tan, & this KeaBabies. I will say, the Boba is hands down the best wrap there is. KeaBabies is an okay runner up in comparison, but it is not stretchy, therefore is not as comfortable as the Boba for longer wear periods, & not comfortable for baby to fall asleep in (too constricting).
customer_reviews.author: Lauraavon83

customer_reviews.title: hate this thing
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a genius yet I'm not mentally challenged either and I had no idea how to use this thing! I tried at least 25 times and this did not feel secure for my baby nor did it feel comfortable. My husband tried to wrap it a bunch of different ways that works for him and it just looked ridiculous. Even with the new born hug hold, I was not hands free and had to support my baby's head the entire time so this contraption is useless. I'm glad other people were able to make it work for them, but perhaps I'm just too old fashioned and need a normal carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Racquelle

customer_reviews.title: Wasn’t a fan.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try a wrap style carrier with my second baby, as it seemed so convenient, especially during the newborn phase when they love to be close and snuggled. With my first I used an ergo the entire time. Although I loved the idea of this carrier, it didn’t work for us. I didn’t love the fabric, and it felt too warm for us. Also- it was just way too much of a hassle to deal with when putting it on. When you’ve got a crying baby and you’re trying to hurry up and wrap this thing around you, it’s a pain. I ended up buying an infantino wrap that I LOVE because it’s partially assembled for you.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable once you spend the time to figure it out
customer_reviews.text: There is SOOO much fabric for this item. Maybe it’s because I am a smaller person and don’t need it, but it seems excessive and hard to handle!!! I personally did not like this wrap. I could never find a position that I felt comfortable or that my babies head position looked safe to me. It takes quite some time to put on each time and I had to practice a lot. I definitely am a bigger fan of the ease and simplicity of my front packs! I also found this to make me and baby sweat a lot. I know many moms love these, just not for me!
customer_reviews.author: Tim & Riss Patnode

customer_reviews.title: Great, firm hold
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the newborn stage. I didn't like my Boba because it wasnt supportive enough. The material of this one is more structured and holds baby better. It's also less hot. The Solly is the best for a firm hold and breathable material but I didn't have $80 to spare at the time. This worked perfectly well and for how short of a time these work for babies, I'm glad I bought the cheaper one.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget Robben

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This baby securely and snugly holds my newborn to my chest, which makes him very happy and allows me to get things done. The material is soft but doesn’t stretch too much. I had to watch a YouTube video several times to understand how to use it correctly but after a few tries, it’s a no-brained and I can get it on in a minute. It’s not super breathable material, but definitely doesn’t trap as much heat as my Ergo 369 with the infant insert. For the price, this was a great purchase. I’ve used it almost every day since it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Klh2013

customer_reviews.title: Not for thick women
customer_reviews.text: I’m a size 14/16, this was not long enough to tie/wrap. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Its not 1 size fits all
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my daughter for a baby shower gift. Its been to long to return it otherwise I would. Its too small, even though it says one size fits all. My daughter is a size 12.
customer_reviews.author: lisa paris

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy baby wrap
customer_reviews.text: Took a while for my newborn to take to it. The wrap can get pretty hot esp if you are walking around cleaning and such. Once you’re able to get the baby wrapped correctly, it is helpful. Make sure you don’t do it right after a feeding though otherwise it’s barf and spit up all over you and your baby. The material is nice, stretchy, sturdy and soft. Once my baby turned 3 weeks, he became colicky and wrapping did help at times.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: not safe!
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely not to be used for a newborn! And then a heavier baby would just be too big and I wouldn't feel secure with him in there at all! It's just this super long ridiculous looking thick fabric that you're supposed to wrap in a million different directions to get it to be how it should, and then even still the newborn baby literally disappears in it! That's a serious health hazard! But on top of that, even with having done it right I wouldn't feel secure with any size/age child going in there as it's just not sturdy at all. Sorry for the bad post but this is no good and not safe
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Nice wrap for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pros: puts baby to sleep instantly Comfortable I like the way it looks Cons: baby will sink down into if after awhile I feel like baby's head always ends up kinked at a weird angle For people concerned with difficulty of getting the wrap on, it's not that hard and the directions are pretty clear and easy. They also have YouTube videos if you need more instruction. I was successful after reading directions once and was wearing my 3 week old baby in no time. I really like the muted colors and the fabric itself. It is a relief to be able to go hands free and get things done while still holding my baby
customer_reviews.author: Humblebee

customer_reviews.title: Easy on my back
customer_reviews.text: The wrap fit nicely. I’m a big woman with a big baby (20 lbs). He is a heavy kid, but this wrap lightened the load. It took me a couple of tries to figure out how tight to get it, but the seller emailed a how-to video a day or so after I received the product which greatly helped. I actually started the wrap on my chest, and wrapped just like the booklet showed. I like that the wrap came in a box. It would make an excellent baby shower gift. It also has a bag to store the wrap in when not in use or when needing to take it with you. It’s a great price as well.
customer_reviews.author: S Enoch

customer_reviews.title: Get this if you want a lightweight wrap
customer_reviews.text: This is the best wrap I’ve ever used. I also have two moby’s and an ergo carrier. This is super light weight, very stretchy, easy to use, I can’t say enough good things about it! The color goes with everything. It doesn’t sag. It fits both me and my husband who’s a sturdy man. And she doesn’t sweat her tiny little butt off in this thing, even during the summer!! Amazing price point. But even if it cost 3 times more, it would still be worth it. It’s better than all the rest of my expensive carriers.
customer_reviews.author: Cassidy Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Happy Second Time Mom!!!
customer_reviews.text: Omg!!! I ordered this last night out of frustration having to hold my 5 week old every second! Ordered around 9 pm last night and it arrived 2pm. I immediately decided to try it out. Instructions are super easy to follow if you READ and dont just go with the pictures. I got it on the first try. My screaming daughter was in it for 7 minutes and fell asleep. It's super soft not scratchy at all. Love that the material stretched but not too much so I feel secure with baby in it. Dont think 2x get it!!! So much better than my Infantino carrier that made my back and sciatica nerve hurt after 15 minutes. Get it moms!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney O.

customer_reviews.title: No more sweaty boobs, they could breathe! Along with baby!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried over a half dozen of carriers and wraps for my newborn. This one is by far the best! I love how lightweight it feels on me. Some of the others I tried had my boobs sweating within 15 mins and my baby would get agitated because he was getting to hot. My baby LOVES this wrap. If he is fussy I quickly put him in it and less than 5-10 mins he is already asleep. It helps with his reflux too. I cant immediately lay him down after feeding so I carry him in this wrap and he doesn't reflux. I am very happy with this purchase and for the price it's great quality!
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Keeps grabby hands away from newborn
customer_reviews.text: I really like the wrap for my 3 week old. I knew I needed something to prevent grabby hands when we have to go to highly populated areas as well as hands free getting things done around the house when he's fussy. I got carried from my baby shower but he hated those and still sank down into them too deep. Enter this wrap. We were so comfortable after watching the video and getting the wrap down pat he stayed in it during his 3 hour nap while I got things done! Will definitely continue to use.
customer_reviews.author: Meaghan

customer_reviews.title: Great way to snuggle baby w/o buckles and zips!
customer_reviews.text: I really really really enjoy this wrap! I typically stay away from these cause they seem so complicated but I got it right on the first try and it was PERFECTION. Baby was instantly asleep being all snuggled up on me. Plus it’s hands free so it makes doing other things easier. You can get sweaty pretty quick with it on (between you and baby mostly, as expected) but it is mostly breathable. When putting baby in, just make sure you tied it good so the baby doesn’t slip out. They have a bunch of tutorials to help! Would def recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie T

customer_reviews.title: As pictured
customer_reviews.text: Recieved it today on time. Opened package and it's everything advertised so far. Followed the instructions in the package to try it on; not as hard as I thought it would be. I'm still pregnant, so the baby obliviously hasn't been in there. 4 stars for that reason but will update when that happens. Update: I didn't use it until after she was 2 months just because I wasn't comfortable putting her in but now that's she's older, I love it. I mostly just use it to take her walking in our back yard. I like that there's enough material to cover her legs (protects against insects) and occasionally her arms .
customer_reviews.author: Hindira Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Fabric too heavy ! I want to return
customer_reviews.text: The fabric is too heavy . I’ve tried to wear one time and doesn’t work . I want to return the product and I can’t !!!! I was out of town and I had hurricane season in my county , impossible to fix this thing earlier . I wanna return or my money back !!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ana C.

customer_reviews.title: You need two people if you're not flexible or have short arms.
customer_reviews.text: I did not know this was a product that I had to wrap myself. I was confused on how to do this even though it came with instructions. I have short arms so the instructions showed you only needed one person. After I got another person to help though it worked perfectly. My baby slightly likes it. He likes to have his feet out but he is still working on holding his own head up, so we had to use the bigger kid version and I just had to hold his head. Overall a great product though, I just recommend using this with your baby from the start and not after months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice! Fits plus size moms
customer_reviews.text: Fabric is just the right amount of soft and stretchy but sturdy. Pretty easy to figure out with the instruction booklet, the hardest part is figuring out how tight you want it but a couple practice rounds and you’ll be fine. I’m one week post partum and I got my maternity clothes in 2XL, I just tie it in the back instead of wrapping it to the front again and it feels like it fits great and would probably fit someone with a couple inches more than me even, so plus size moms can feel comfortable with this carrier. Super happy with it, especially since baby carriers usually cost twice this amount.
customer_reviews.author: Rogan

customer_reviews.title: 2nd set of arms
customer_reviews.text: Get it! I’m plus size and I still have fabric left over. Being a mom of twins I can’t hold them at the same time but I can with this. I also use it when I’m putting them to sleep while on the glider. I tend to get sleepy while rocking them and I’m afraid of dropping the baby. So, I use it as a safety net for those long nights. Took me a few tries to get used to tying it, literally like 4 times and I was good. Game changer for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Bejarano

customer_reviews.title: Moby wrap at half the price
customer_reviews.text: This is just like the moby wrap but half the price. I had the moby wrap with my other kids and loved it. It came in handy when nursing in public and i take the bus so i like having my baby close so nobody can touch her, plus rather than taking her in a bulky stroller i just put her in this wrap. If your debating between buying this one or the moby wrap definitely go with this keababies wrap because it is literally exactly the same but half the price! I couldn't believe how affordable it was but still feels expensive and good material.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Kegley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the new baby
customer_reviews.text: Wife's niece had a baby girl about 4 weeks ago, and everyone got her all kinds of baby products, but no one got her a baby wrap. Picked this one because it had good review, gray is fairly neutral, and the price was right. The niece loved the wrap and even used it 2 weeks later when she went to a rally and she used it to hold her baby girl for 6 hours. Baby was comfortable and slept through almost the entire rally. Niece is super happy and wants another one for her husband.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry H.Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: More difficult than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a wrap style carrier for my newborn. I was able to get this one nice and snug - it definitely worked as advertised. I only expected the tying process to be easier. After taking 15 minutes to put the baby on my chest and the toddler in a buggie to run inside a store in South Louisiana September heat and humidity, I was exhausted for the day! This is a great product if you want a wrap for inside the house, and for baby to feel your closeness.. but for errands, my suggestion would be another easier product, or just wait until the baby can fit in a faster wrap before shopping!
customer_reviews.author: Meghan M.

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted it to work for me
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited, but this did not work for me. I watched the videos and followed the steps. But with a C-sec it was very uncomfortable and not flattering at all. Living up north and using layers, it became uncomfortable and a mess. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: FCM

customer_reviews.title: So comfy!
customer_reviews.text: I love how comfortable this is. My husband is big and tall and he loves using it too. The fabric is breathable so you aren't too warm while using it. Other wraps that I tried required you to wash every few uses because they got stretched out, but I have used this many many times without washing in between and never had to worry about it stretching out.
customer_reviews.author: wemke

customer_reviews.title: Great material and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: After using this for a week, I have to say it’s an awesome buy. I can’t believe I never had one of these with my first two kids. The material is soft and stretchy. I was worried since some of the reviews mwntioned this wasn’t for “heavier” ladies but I had no issue with it at all. I am 5 foot 5 inches and weigh roughly 160 lbs and have no issues wrapping this around myself as shown in the instruction pamphlet. I watched other YouTube videos and they said you can wrap around your waist once rather than two and it should still work fine. I’m conclusion, I am happy with this and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CPerf

customer_reviews.title: Baby approved!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Thank first it was a little difficult to understand how to use it but after watching YouTube videos a couple of times I have it down! I’m 5’1 so when I’m wrapping it I have to be on a clean surface because it will drag on the floor but I understand it has to be longer since it’s a universal size. Other than that it’s great!
customer_reviews.author: Josie

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: Just received this in the mail and I was so excited that I already tried it out. I watched several YouTube videos prior to purchasing so I found it easy to get started. I absolutely love it and believe its going to help me actually be able to get things done around the house. Baby constantly wants to be held at this stage. Only issue I can foresee is when I want to use this on the go. It is so long that it drags on the ground when wrapping. It's perfect length though as I am heavier set so there is enough fabric to wrap around. Overall I am happy with my purchase. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: My Hands are Free!
customer_reviews.text: Just received this today and I have never been so happy about an amazon purchase as much as this! I have. $200 ergo baby carrier, but this is way better. I can’t get my baby in the ergo baby by myself, but with this I can. It’s super easy to use and you can adjust the bottom to support the babies neck. My baby is only a month old and I feel he is secure. I can finally walk my dogs or sweep my house. The fabric is soft and thin enough to wear under jacket. I haven’t washed it so I hope it holds up in the washer. Perfect!! Save some $ and get this carrier!
customer_reviews.author: mpopwoah

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic purchase
customer_reviews.text: We use this wrap everyday. It’s amazing. The material feels great & has held up well to frequent washing. Our little babe is not so little, lol, he’s about 22 lbs & this still holds him very well. We have a ring sling, a bjorn, & an ergo baby carrier, and this is by far the best & most used carrier we have. Don’t waste your money on anything else. Also, if you need a little more head support for your little one, we just roll up a clean cloth diaper liner in the wrap at his neck/shoulders. It keeps his head very stable & is super easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Yayyyy for wraps!!!
customer_reviews.text: This wrap is SO COMFORTABLE. There is a definite learning curve because it’s so long, but no different from any other wrap. I have a Moby and like this one just as much (dare I say maybe even more?). It is super soft and stretchy and my go-to when baby doesn’t want to nap in her bassinet or when I want to wear her out and about. I would say for longer trips get a sturdier carrier (when I walk the dogs or do long walks / hikes I use my lillebaby carrier, not this). But for around town quick trips, this totally works! Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to wear
customer_reviews.text: I have worn all my babies! I have several carriers. I use the ergobaby for out and about, I have a wild bird sling, but find it hurts my shoulder, I’ve used the moby wrap in the past and now have this wrap- and i love it! It’s very comfortable to wear and makes me feel close to my baby while having my hands free (I LOVE my ergo but not for home use- it’s not as close a feeling) the color is nice and neutral. The price is great! I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Erin F.

customer_reviews.title: Preemie mom.
customer_reviews.text: My little boy decided to come 11 weeks early and this has been the best for doing skin to skin time with him. I feel he is very secure when I do the newborn hug hold. He absolutely loves it and is very comfortable. I can walk around the hospital room with him in it. Once he gets quite a bit bigger we will start the basic tie. But the newborn hug hold has worked as great for him at 2 lbs 6 oz as it does at 4 lbs 6 oz. I highly recommend. It doesn't get over stretched from use.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Fricker

customer_reviews.title: I am now a baby wearing mom and love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a game changer! My baby is one month old and wants to be held a lot since my husband started working again. It was preventing me from getting anything done and my son is too small for his actual baby carrier right now. I put this real quick, hoping for some help... and I got it! It fully supports his head and neck, and almost cocoons him like in the womb. It's decently easy to use, but I'm new at it and it gets better each time. My son loves and immediately goes to sleep in it.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan K

customer_reviews.title: Easy to wrap but material is too warm
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this wrap because in general it gets the job done. It’s easy to wrap and my son enjoys being in it. The problem is the material of the cloth is too hot. Keep in mind I live in Minnesota and I keep my house temperature around 69-72 degrees and most of the time my son will be very warm and sweating. The material needs to be improved, other than that I like it, I’ve had no issues putting it on and it instantly calms my baby down. I hope this was helpful :)
customer_reviews.author: Cat Rios

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as expensive wraps
customer_reviews.text: Once you get the hang of wrapping it’s easy peasy. I have expensive and cheap wraps and these are just as good as the pricier options. I will say that the fabric is a bit thicker than my other wraps but I have a winter baby so I don’t mind. The color is vibrant and baby feels secure. Will recommend to future mamas!
customer_reviews.author: castmember19

customer_reviews.title: Really fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: Was alot simpler to use than i expected. Takes 1-3 tries at home for practice. I ONLY don’t like how at certain parts of putting it on, it had to touch the ground. It gets dirt quickly because of that, but the length is understandable so I’m not upset about it. I just worry about needing to put it on in public spaces (has to put it on in a doctor offices bathroom. Was very worried about germs in that case. I don’t worry too much about dirt or anything if I’m outside, though).
customer_reviews.author: N. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great material (soft yet sturdy), and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality material - soft, breathable, and stretchy, yet sturdy (holds up baby well). The light gray is a nice unisex color and isn’t too light where you see all stains. But even if you get a stain the material washes well. I watched the YouTube tutorial on how to tie and place the baby in it properly, and after I did it once, I had no issues using it. Because it is long so there’s a lot of material, it does take up quite a bit of room in the diaper bag but not enough to be an issue (everything else we need still fits perfectly fine in there).
customer_reviews.author: Cocotelle

customer_reviews.title: Purchase this!
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed. Great quality and price. I chose this over more expensive products and am very happy. UPDATE: The quality is great after use and washing/drying. My complaint is that this thing is wayyyyy too long for my liking. I avoid using this because the wrap always gets all over the floor of my car while trying to get it on while on the go. I am 5'5 and around 110 lbs. I think this is great for taller/larger people but personally I would prefer a shorter wrap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great baby wrap at reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: This is the only baby wrap I've ever used, so I don't have anything to compare it to, but I really like the Kea Babies wrap carrier. It's soft and breathable with the right amount of stretch, and I love the versatile grey color. I also like the tapered ends of the wrap, makes it feel a little more fashionable than just a rectanglar shape. The how to videos in the follow-up email were really helpful too, although I'd like to see those links in the Amazon description to watch before buying. But all in all, a great baby wrap for a lot less money than the typical Moby or similar brands.
customer_reviews.author: Gwenelle

customer_reviews.title: A comfortable carrier without all the bulk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my daughter. She is bigger about a size 2x. she just gave birth to twins and about two weeks after we try using it. It was big enough but not a lot of excess however it's still works. I would say anyone over a size 3x probably would not be able to use it. I am a medium and on me I think there will be quite a bit of excess. I am not sure I would order it for myself I would prefer a little smaller I think. But in all fairness I have not really tried it out with the babies yet. All in all a good product I think.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Great product, and affordable!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this wrap! I have a bad back, but this carrier doesn’t hurt my back at all! It’s very comfortable. And my baby loves it as well! I also love that this carrier is decently priced without being cheaply made. It’s great quality!
customer_reviews.author: Monique

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: It’s surprisingly easy to use! The instructions and the videos provided made this easier than expected. My daughter loves to be swaddled and close to me at all times. This carrier made it easy for me to actually get things done around the house while on leave of absence. My hubby was even impressed with this as I helped him put this on and our baby easily calmed down. The material is breathable so I never worry about her wrapped up in this carrier and it’s breathable for myself so super comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Channell

customer_reviews.title: awesome for the quality and price!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research to find a nice quality wrap. I have an ergobaby but my large newborn still couldn't quite fit it comfortably so I wanted a wrap. This is perfect! Easy to use (I read the booklet and went on YouTube and watched their tutorials and picked it up on the first try!) My son falls asleep right away. It comes with a nice little drawstring bag that fits perfectly in my diaper bag! When I've gone somewhere and couldn't use my stroller, this was a life saver!
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey L.

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! Im a thicker woman so I was worried about these not working, but this one said it worked for plus sized gals, so I thought for the price what the hell, I'd try it! The fabric is strong, it feels sturdy, and my 3 month old daughter loved being snuggled up to me while I worked! My only complaint was that it did have a weird smell coming from it when I first opened it, but a quick wash, which I had intended on doing anyway, solved that no problemo! Definitely a great value for the cost!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Baureis

customer_reviews.title: Confusing
customer_reviews.text: This wrap works great once you figure it out but even then you have to spend at least 2-3 minutes putting it on before you can put your child in it. Which any new parent knows that 2-3 minutes of a screaming baby is enough to not even put this on and take the time to do it. The only time this gets used is when it is put on before leaving the house in anticipation of placing our daughter in it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey L Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and easy to learn
customer_reviews.text: This is my second baby and for my first I had gotten one of those heavier padded carriers. It was so uncomfortable and I used it once and never used it again. For this baby, comfort and safety was my biggest concern. I received it and saw it came with a little book of different wrapping options and thought " Oh no it going to be difficult" but I decided to grab a doll and practice and I realized its so comfortable and not as difficult as I thought. It made me extremely excited to see how baby feels inside of it.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: It is huge and very uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge. It is a very large and ling piece of a cloth hanging on the floor when you try to wrap it around you. It gathers all the dust and everything else before you manage to wrap it around your body. When you are done, it doesn’t even look nearly close to what you see in picture. It looks very messy, not neat, very uncomfortable to carry, especially in warm weather. Maybe if you are 2 feet something tall and big it could look good but I doubt it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Hot, and hard to use for me.
customer_reviews.text: First of all, first time baby wearer here. I liked how affordable this was, but unfortunately I had to return it. It took me so long to put on, and I never felt like I did it right and didn’t feel comfortable having my baby in it. It didn’t feel secure. My son is also hot a lot, so am I, and it wasn’t very breathable. I got SO hot in it and it was only spring time, couldn’t wear this in the summer. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah St Clair

customer_reviews.title: Could Never Get It To Work
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea how this is supposed to work. I watched the video and read the directions over and over and could never get it set up. The resell shops near me won't buy it either so now I just use it as a shopping cart cover. This was useless as a wrap.
customer_reviews.author: Super Cutie

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use, soft fabric, my little one loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this wrap! We also have a Lillebaby carrier but I prefer to use this one. It's perfect for around the house if my LO is getting fussy and I need to wear her but still get stuff done. Plus it's very sturdy and I have confidently worn it out on several occasions to run errands. The material is really soft and my LO loves this carrier. I just get her situated and she instantly falls asleep while wearing it!
customer_reviews.author: The Anti Bridezilla

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, great for newborns. Can’t wait to use as he grows
customer_reviews.text: I was wanting to try a wrap this time around for my newborn as I’ve had a bad experience with other carriers with my first. I was a little skeptical as I wasn’t sure if this would fit me comfortably. After reading a ton of reviews I decided to try it. So far my baby has loved it! It gets some getting use to with the wrapping part but once you get it down it’s pretty easy. I’ve used this around the house and doing a target stroll as I don’t want ppl touching or peeking in on baby since it is flu season right now. It’s comfortable and my son loves it (:
customer_reviews.author: 808LO

customer_reviews.title: It's not near as good as the reviews made it seem.
customer_reviews.text: Me and my wife just did not like this. I had high hopes because of the positive reviews, but it really wasn't great at all. It is always awkward trying to put the baby in the carrier, not to mention taking her out! It was just more of a hassle, and I felt like I had to hold on to the baby the whole time anyways. We ended up buying a carrier that has clips and it works so much better!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: Updated review: I am pleasantly surprised by the KeaBabies customer service. Without any prompting, they reached out to us when they realized we were less than excited by our purchase and made things right. They were efficient and friendly. For those in the market for a baby wrap, I think the KeaBaby option is a very good one as the company clearly and firmly stands by their product and your satisfaction Original review: Honestly, this just isn't that easy to use and the structured carriers seem to be much more functional and comfortable for baby and parent.
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: 300lbs momma can use with ease!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a plus sized mom, size US 24. I found this incredibly easy to use and just the right amount of stretch and support. Some things to note that may have been why it works for me, I'm a C cup so smaller breasts than what I think most PS moms are, that may be why this wrap feels great and comfortable for me. I found one double knot perfectly secure for my needs and baby sleeps great in this. Let's me be hands free and able to do work and housework just fine. I will definitely be placing this on my baby must have lists for future gift giving.
customer_reviews.author: SeraLunaria

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, secure, and soft.
customer_reviews.text: This wrap is so soft, and I actually feel like it's so secure! For size reference, I am a woman size 16 and I wore my 3 year old. It definitely will work for tiny babies as well as toddlers! The material is great and not irritating against your skin. It is very light weight. I absolutely love that it comes with a carrying case, I was not expecting that. My daughter loved it and fid not want put down. I definitely recommend snatching this up! It's a perfect baby shower gift. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Little man loves to be worn!!! If he is fussy at all he goes in the wrap and is happy and content within minutes! He was 5 weeks premature started using the wrap when he hit 6 lbs. I make sure his head and neck is really supported. The key for me is wrap it as tight as you can. The wrap will stretch to accommodate him. Took me about 3 times wrapping before I really felt I had the hang of it. This is the first baby item I have felt like I’ll be getting my moneys worth out of! Love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Buy it! Amazing !
customer_reviews.text: My baby is 4 months old now and I’ve been using this since he was a newborn baby. You can put the baby in so many position, it’s so comfortable,it’s super easy to wash, it’s fresh enough for summer and warm enough for winter, and it’s hands free thank goodness, because if you have 2 other children like I do you need to be hands free, get this it’s worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Liliana Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Only way she’ll sleep
customer_reviews.text: Baby only wants to be held and to contact nap, she absolutely loves it. It’s the only way I can get anything done around the house! She’s now 3 months old and 15 pounds. Her chunky butt still feels pretty secure, only complaint is that it takes time to learn how to get it on properly. It can be pretty frustrating when she’s crying and your trying to wrap it
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Skip the expensive ones - this is perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't buy one of these with my first child, and I wish I had now. It took a few tries to get it figured out, but now it's easy! I hate that it's so long that it drags on the floor when you're putting it on, but it has to be long to wrap around yourself several times. I started putting it on before I leave the house so I don't have to drag it across the ground. The material is super soft and is a great quality for the price. I'm not sure why would pay $50+ for a more well known name brand when this one works perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great wrap all around.
customer_reviews.text: This has been such an amazing product to use. Due to my c-section, I am not supposed to lift my baby in her carrier. It makes running errands with her very difficult. However, with the wrap, I can run in and out of the stores as needed. My little one also loves to snuggle on me and this helps to keep her close to me and happy. Its light weight and comfortable. Also easy to use. I'm a bigger girl and it's still wonderful. On top of it all that price is hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: WolfWorx

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price
customer_reviews.text: This wrap is priced so reasonably! I ordered the Mystic Gray wrap and my baby loves it. My baby loves to be carried, and will cry when sleepy and won't fall asleep unless I am holding baby! This wrap is made of really excellent material. I watched the video and it's really easy to wrap! My baby is about 8lbs and 3 weeks, and always fall asleep when in the wrap. I would definitely recommend to new moms.
customer_reviews.author: Christine P.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I regret not buying this sooner! My baby boy is 9Months 20lbs and fits in here perfectly and comfortably. Ive purchased and returned others because they were extremely uncomfortable and did not stretch at all! The material the kea babies wrap is made of us amazing. It’s so soft, has the perfect amount of stretch and is beautiful. I can’t wait to wear my baby everywhere!
customer_reviews.author: Steph Viz

customer_reviews.title: Not that easy to tie it on
customer_reviews.text: this sling is probably as good as the one they sold in the early 1900s. It's just a piece of cloth that requires you to tie your baby onto your body., and the process of tying it can be lengthy and sometimes bothersome. I guess the security depends on how tight you tie it. Nonetheless, this sling is elastic and soft, which provides decent comfort, I just wish it's more user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Amadeus

customer_reviews.title: Simple, soft, strong carrier
customer_reviews.text: I tried a baby carrier way too late and wish I had purchased this earlier! My little guy wanted no parts of a carrier when I got this wrap when he was about 3 months old. Originally, we were gifted a Chicco carrier that had so many buckles and straps it gave me anxiety just looking at it. This wrap is just one long piece of super soft and strong fabric. I’m keeping it for baby number 2 in hopes of baby-wearing success!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: The best wrap!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my sister - her second baby is just over a year behind her first, and she needed a great wrap to be able to have her hands free. This wrap is breathable (perfectly comfortable in hot summer weather), very easy to put on, and works well with both the baby and the toddler. She had a few different wraps with her first baby, but says this one is lightyears better!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for needy babies
customer_reviews.text: My baby always wanted to be with me or carried in order to be content so I invested in this baby wrap simply to make him feel secure and happy while I get chores done around the house. Its comfy, and easy to wrap once you get the hang of it (I would recommend going on YouTube for baby wrap tutorials) my baby is not super big on facing me in the wrap now that he's nearly two months but he likes to face forward to look around.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia M. Perea

customer_reviews.title: Love!!
customer_reviews.text: Love! Is soooo soft and wraps very well around me and baby! He enjoys this much more than the other structure one, it’s isn’t rough with straps and everything. The color is so vibrant, I got the copper grey, and I love it’s unisex for future babies. I love this because is easier to wear around the house and especially when i need to squeeze in a cat nap for him!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Shore

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this wrap a few times so far with my newborn but I'm already in love with it! It's very breathable fabric, has just the right amount of stretch while still feeling sturdy, and I love that it's plus size friendly, and for half the price of the name brands! It takes a bit of practice to get it wrapped properly, but I haven't had any issues so far and my baby always feels very secure in it. She loves napping while being snuggled so this is a great way to be more hands free while also getting snuggles!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Gosney-Baker

customer_reviews.title: I like the idea of this carrier
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of this carrier, but it is a tremendous hastle to put on - there is SO much fabric, and the fabric itself is kind of rough. It's definitely overpriced for what it is - which is simply a strip of fabric. Would be a lot better if it came partially assembled like with the shoulder straps at least and then you just adjust the waist tie.
customer_reviews.author: claire kean

customer_reviews.title: Good for newborns and smaller babies
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 different types of wraps and baby carriers. Honestly, this style works well for my baby when he is tiny but now is very hard to use it on him (6 months) because he grows big. He appears to be uncomfortable when wrapped. I would recommend it to newborn and small baby moms and dads.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Great Price for Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Love this wrap! Easy to use and super convenient to carry your baby hands free. The wrap is really long but it’s perfect to adjust how you would like to fit and will grow with baby. The material is breathable a little thick but in comparison to other wraps I’ve tried it’s lighter in my opinion. I live in Arizona so being in heat any wrap would be hot to wear for a long period of time if your outside. Overall, great buy for such a great price and quality product! This mommy is a #keamommy for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Chrisi Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Nice carrier
customer_reviews.text: After you get the hang of it it’s pretty easy to use. I prefer the YouTube tutorial over the booklet. I like this one for around the house when my son wants to be held but I have to get stuff done and I use my backpack carrier when we’re out and about. It’s comfortable too but it’s not the most stylish because it’s super long and you might have to wrap it a few times
customer_reviews.author: Maddison Hill

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat the price!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this once I got the hang of it! I find my baby is a bit warm after using it. It’s cold right now so The thickness of it is great but once it starts to warm up I don’t know how much I’ll be able to use it. Seriously makes shopping and events I go to so much easier with my hands free and able to deal with my toddler. My baby sleeps practically the whole time as the walking and being against me soothes him.
customer_reviews.author: ABourgeois

customer_reviews.title: Pretty color and soft material
customer_reviews.text: This is my first baby and his first wrap so can’t do a comparison review but this wrap is very soft and feels breathable. It has some amount of stretch with an underlying stiffness of pure cotton. Overall liked the material and the ice blue color is very pretty specially because it’s unisex wrt to baby as well as parents. Length is standard and fits well for me (5’) or my husband (5-11’). My baby is currently 8.7lb and was able to hold him pretty steadily.
customer_reviews.author: Sky

customer_reviews.title: Nice one
customer_reviews.text: I loved it at first for my newborn but it’s really getting too hot for both of us in there After a while , I mean you must use it For outdoor and. Cooler weather I’ve just used it at home since in Texas no chance to go out with it it’s too hot here Other then that it’s comfortable and baby falls a sleep pretty fast there
customer_reviews.author: Romy naim

customer_reviews.title: Takes a while for baby to get used to.
customer_reviews.text: At first my son didn't like it, so I was going to give it away, but then I kept insisting on trying once again. He's getting used to it now so we're keeping it. I like the snugged closeness compared to other carriers. Not too shabby. Would recommend it. Decent price too.
customer_reviews.author: Tomay Xiong

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Baby loves it.
customer_reviews.text: After watching many YouTube videos I realized that this wrap is just as good if not better than the more expensive Moby or Solly wraps. We put my crying 8 week old grandson in it the first day it came and he immediately quieted and fell asleep. It’s just stretchy enough with enough support to feel comfortable for Mama and baby. We’re looking forward to trying out some different wrapping techniques we’ve seen on YouTube.
customer_reviews.author: wonderdogmom

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you free and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I was incredibly intimidated by the wrap but my newborn was to small for my normal carrier but with 2 toddlers already staying mobile and hands free was a must. Took the leap and purchased this wrap- the box it came in had a video link to teach a wrapping technique that has changed my life! I’m still not a pro but it’s easy enough and certainly gets the job done. My little can fall asleep on me while still leaving me free to help and play with the older kids.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Soft material
customer_reviews.text: Works good for babies who are nosey. My little one is super nosey and always wants to be where everyone is. This helps me get things done and als9 let her be with everyone. She thinks she an adult and in every conversation so this helps her relax and be calm without ne having to carry her around. Material is nice and soft but does hold heat so you don't want to have a sweater on wearing this.
customer_reviews.author: Shay

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have bought this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have gotten this sooner. I used a ring sling for the first two month with my baby and I could never trust that he wouldn’t slip out the bottom. I don’t have any concerns with this wrap. I can truly have the use of both my hands! The fabric has just enough stretch and is light and airy but durable. I love this wrap. My baby is 3 months now and he loves being in it.
customer_reviews.author: Tawny

customer_reviews.title: Love it!! Going to get one more for my friend!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutly love this sling!! I bought it last week and I fell in love and my son loves it so much! It is really soft and strach easily! I learned how to use so quickly and now it’s my favorite baby product! I feel like my son is really light when I use it and I can do so much stuff since my hands are free! And also my son sleeps in it so quicky! I’m totally going to buy one more for my friend!
customer_reviews.author: Alie ma

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: It’s comfortable to wear, however... It’s soooo long and a pain in the butt to fold. I wish it offered a little more neck support. Overall, it’s ok. It’s fairly easy to use, but takes longer because it is so long.
customer_reviews.author: NDMama_CBIV

customer_reviews.title: Good wrap!
customer_reviews.text: I like this wrap! I really appreciate the seller as well, it’s a family business and they explain their backstory in a little booklet along with clear instructions on how to put on/place baby in wrap. My only complaint is that the material is rather thick and my baby sweats in this if he’s in it for long periods of time. My husband doesn’t see this as a negative though, he said well just use this wrap in the winter when it’s cold :).
customer_reviews.author: Ibuythings

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: This is a lifesaver, especially when you have a fussy, teething baby! Allows me to still have a life while giving my baby the comfort and closeness she needs. I wish I would have bought this 3 months ago! If you're on the fence, buy it! Make sure to wrap "snugly" or the baby slips a little bit. You want it snug enough so baby is close to you but not so tight that they are being squeezed lol. Took me a few tries, but it's easy after the first few times 😊
customer_reviews.author: Tamie A.

customer_reviews.title: Great way to get things done and bond with baby!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a first time mom and decided to purchase this because my little one wouldn’t let me put her down so I could eat or get housework done. I was starting to get overwhelmed until a friend suggested this baby carrier. I am so glad I bought this! It is pretty easy to figure out after watching some videos and it doesn’t loosen/stretch out while wearing it throughout the day. This is truly a good quality wrap and now I’m able to do things for myself and the household while my baby snuggles up against me. This product is worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: P. Mason

customer_reviews.title: Worth it and cost effective
customer_reviews.text: I only am giving 4 stars just because of my own insecurities. I’m still unsure of using the item. But I’m sure it will take me more practice. I tend to be a person that hot easily, but the fabric is very lightweight. The instructions are easy to understand plus they include links for videos. My little girl loves being in it. Definitely worth it for such a low cost!! Great price point.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Ball

customer_reviews.title: supportive, comfortable, fits plus size mamas!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this wrap. I've purchased at least 4 different wraps over the past couple years between having 2 babies I wanted the perfect wrap and this one is by far my favorite. I have used it nearly everyday with my newborn. he sleeps so comfortably in it. The fabric isn't too thick and it has some stretch which allows my son to have some wiggly room with plenty of support! Definitely recommend to all new moms! Also, as a plus size mom it is very hard to find a wrap that fits and this one fits great!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Best Invention Ever
customer_reviews.text: I was going to wait at least a week before I reviewed this, but after a day and a half I already know I absolutely love this!! My baby is a month old right now and he’s been fighting his sleep and getting super cranky and crying and right when I put him in this he knocks out instantly every time. The material is super breathable which makes me feel safe about putting him in the wrap and I know he’ll be okay with it during the summer. I’m so glad I finally decided to buy one of these. Great price, great material, great product what else could a busy mama ask for.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna Ponce

product_meta.title: Baby Wrap Carrier All-in-1 Stretchy Baby Wraps - Baby Sling - Infant Carrier - Babys Wrap - Hands Free Babies Carrier Wraps - Baby Shower Gift (Classic Gray)
feature_bullets: JUST THE RIGHT STRETCH - Our baby wrap carrier is specially designed using stretchy yet sturdy fabric so that baby’s weight will not be straining to your tired back & shoulders after long period of usage. The right amount of elasticity also keeps your baby safe and snug in the wrap without having to constantly readjust the wrap. This is the trusted front facing baby wrap carrier, easy to use for new baby wearing moms!

ONE SIZE FITS ALL - Trusted baby carrier wraps around your body perfectly no matter what size you are! For smaller size mommies, you may loop the wrap to the front and tie it. For bigger size mommies, you may tie the wrap at your back, depending on your comfort. Tried & tested by mommies of all sizes! Our KeaBabies infant carrier is specially designed to distribute weight evenly while you stay hands free.

NO MORE FUSSY & CRYING BABY - Suited for use from newborn all the way to 35lbs, our baby wrap carrier helps you to calm and soothe baby easily by being held close to you. No more tired arms & shoulders! You can even breastfeed conveniently while babywearing your little one

ENHANCED BONDING - Keeping your baby close to you against your chest and listening to your heartbeat makes them feel extra safe and at ease with KeaBabies Baby Wrap Carrier - this special moment creates an even stronger bond for you and your baby. It can double as a Breastfeeding Cover & Postpartum Belly Belt too!
PERFECT BABY SHOWER GIFT - A thoughtful and useful gift of love for all new parents, comes with a cute gift box. The new mom/dad will love the snuggling moments so much!

specifications.Safety warning: Keep your baby under supervision when they are in the baby wrap carrier.
specifications.Care instructions: Machine Wash Cold, Air Dry or Tumble Dry Low. Wash Before First Use.
specifications.Additional product features: Baby Wrap Carrier, Baby Shower Gifts, Baby Wrap, Baby Holder, Baby Sling
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars6,317 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
